1.name: 1. A Place in the Sun
1.description: A poor boy gets a job working for his rich uncle and ends up falling in love with two women.

2.name: 2. Quo Vadis
2.description: After fierce Roman commander Marcus Vinicius becomes infatuated with beautiful Christian hostage Lygia, he begins to question the tyrannical leadership of the despotic emperor Nero.

3.name: 3. Strangers on a Train
3.description: A psychopath tries to forcibly persuade a tennis star to agree to his theory that two strangers can get away with murder by submitting to his plan to kill the other's most-hated person.

4.name: 4. I Love Lucy
4.description: The wife of a band leader constantly tries to become a star - in spite of her having no talent, and gets herself (along with her best friend) into the funniest predicaments.

5.name: 5. A Streetcar Named Desire
5.description: Disturbed Blanche DuBois moves in with her sister in New Orleans and is tormented by her brutish brother-in-law while her reality crumbles around her.

6.name: 6. Alice in Wonderland
6.description: Alice stumbles into the world of Wonderland. Will she get home? Not if the Queen of Hearts has her way.

7.name: 7. The Great Caruso
7.description: The film explores the life of tenor Enrico Caruso, a vocalist who faces rejection from Musetta and Dorothy, and struggles to find acceptance in New York.

8.name: 8. Flying Leathernecks
8.description: Major Kirby leads The Wildcats squadron into the historic WWII battle of Guadalcanal.

9.name: 9. The Day the Earth Stood Still
9.description: An alien lands in Washington, D.C. and tells the people of Earth that they must live peacefully or be destroyed as a danger to other planets.

10.name: 10. The Thing from Another World
10.description: Scientists and American Air Force officials fend off a bloodthirsty alien organism while at a remote arctic outpost.

11.name: 11. The African Queen
11.description: In WWI East Africa, a gin-swilling Canadian riverboat captain is persuaded by a strait-laced English missionary to undertake a trip up a treacherous river and use his boat to attack a German gunship.

12.name: 12. An American in Paris
12.description: Three friends struggle to find work in Paris. Things become more complicated when two of them fall in love with the same woman.

13.name: 13. On Moonlight Bay
13.description: During World War I, a teenage girl begins a romance with a college student, but his unconventional attitudes cause friction with her father.

14.name: 14. Sirocco
14.description: A cynical American expatriate gets involved in smuggling and gun-running for the rebels during the 1925 Syrian insurgency against French occupation.

15.name: 15. The Lavender Hill Mob
15.description: A meek bank clerk who oversees the shipment of bullion joins with an eccentric neighbor to steal gold bars and smuggle them out of the country as miniature Eiffel Towers.

16.name: 16. On Dangerous Ground
16.description: Rough city cop Jim Wilson is disciplined by his captain and is sent upstate, to a snowy mountain town, to help the local sheriff solve a murder case.

17.name: 17. Badge 714
17.description: Follows Sergeant Joe Friday of the Los Angels Police Department (LAPD) and his various partners as they methodically investigate a different verity of crimes in Los Angeles, California.

18.name: 18. Sky King
18.description: Fly plane... Bust bad guys... Fuss with niece and nephew... Eat Peter Pan Peanut Butter... Dat's it!

19.name: 19. When Worlds Collide
19.description: As a new star and planet hurtle toward a doomed Earth, a small group of survivalists frantically work to complete the rocket which will take them to their new home.

20.name: 20. His Kind of Woman
20.description: A deported gangster's plan to re-enter the USA involves skulduggery at a Mexican resort, and gambler Dan Milner is caught in the middle.

21.name: 21. Ace in the Hole
21.description: Frustrated former journalist Chuck Tatum now working for an Albuquerque newspaper exploits a story about trading post owner Leo Minosa trapped in a cave to rekindle Chuck's career, but the story soon escalates into a media circus.

22.name: 22. The Browning Version
22.description: Andrew Crocker-Harris (Michael Redgrave), a classics teacher at an English school, is afflicted with a heart ailment and an unfaithful wife (Jean Kent). His interest in his pupils wanes as he looks towards his final days in employment.

23.name: 23. The Man in the White Suit
23.description: An altruistic chemist invents a fabric which resists wear and stain as a boon to humanity, but big business and labor realize it must be suppressed for economic reasons.

24.name: 24. No Questions Asked
24.description: An insurance lawyer unhappy with his rate of company advancement becomes a middleman in deals to recover stolen property from the Mob, thus earning a nice living. But his actions attract police attention and set him up for a double-cross.

25.name: 25. Search for Tomorrow
25.description: Jo Gardner lived in Henderson where she wed many times. She was a motel owner, librarian, then a B&B owner with best pal Stu Bergman. Jo's daughter Patti and Janet Bergman were good friends. Stu married first Marge, then Ellie.
